diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis with obstruction and hydrops of the gallbladder
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain, nausea, and vomiting, with a distended gallbladder observed on ultrasound, along with multiple echogenic, shadowing stones and gallbladder wall thickening. These findings, along with the acute presentation after eating, support the diagnosis of acute cholecystitis.
